nodes.description: Nodes are the fundamental building blocks of the mind map, representing categories, concepts, or ideas.

attributes.guid: A unique identifier assigned to each node.
attributes.purpose: The defined reason for the node's existence.
attributes.content: Information or records associated with the node.
attributes.uris: Related links or references associated with the node.

tags.description: Tags are labels used to categorize and organize nodes, documents, or relationships within the mind map.

attributes.guid: A unique identifier for each tag.
attributes.tagCategory: The category or grouping of the tag.
attributes.uris: Related links or references associated with the tag.

relationships.description: Relationships define the connections between nodes, describing how they interact or relate.

attributes.guid: A unique identifier for each relationship.
attributes.fromNode: The starting point of the relationship.
attributes.relationshipType: Describes the nature of the relationship.
attributes.content: Information or records associated with the relationship.
attributes.uris: Related links or references associated with the relationship.

documents.description: Documents represent formal records or agreements tied to nodes, tags, or relationships.

attributes.guid: A unique identifier for each document.
attributes.version: The versioning system for the document.
attributes.status: The document's current status, such as Draft or Published.
attributes.history: Tracking changes and updates over time.
attributes.content: The document's content, which can be text or binary data.
attributes.uri: Where the document is stored, if in a separate database.

versioning.description: Handles the version control of documents and the overall mind map structure.

attributes.minorVersion: The sub-version number for iterative changes.

backupAndRestore.description: Processes for backing up and restoring the mind map and associated documents.

attributes.restoreProcess: Steps to restore from a backup.

contextFilters.description: Filters applied to the mind map to focus on specific contexts or criteria.

attributes.filterName: The name of the context filter.
attributes.filterLogic: The logic applied by the filter.

modelDiagnostics.description: Ensures that changes to the mind map and documents align with the intended structure and rules.

limitations.description: Defines any known limitations of the mind map structure or tools.

attributes.scalability: Limitations related to the size of the mind map.

scalabilityMonitoring.description: Tracks the growth and performance of the mind map.

attributes.size: The current size of the mind map.
attributes.metrics: Metrics related to mind map performance.

metaModelVersioning.description: Tracks changes and versions of the meta-model itself.

attributes.majoreVersion: The main version number of the meta-model.
attributes.minorVersion: The sub-version number for iterative changes.

namingFlexibility.description: Allows for flexibility in naming nodes, tags, and other elements.

attributes.nameRules: Guidelines for naming within the mind map.
attributes.aliasSupport: Support for multiple names or aliases.

deltaUpdateProcess.description: Ensures that updates are applied incrementally without affecting existing data.

attributes.guidelines: All updates should only add or modify necessary elements, leaving existing data intact.
attributes.validation: Pre- and post-update validation to ensure data integrity.

journal.description: A stand-alone entity for capturing raw, unstructured information such as ideas, notes, voice memos, or tweets.

attributes.guid: A unique identifier for each journal entry.
attributes.timestamp: The time when the entry was recorded.
attributes.rawContent: The unstructured content of the entry.
attributes.tags: Optional tags associated with the journal entry.
attributes.context: Related context or references to other parts of the mind map.

journalIntegration.description: Process for summarizing and potentially integrating journal entries into the mind map.

attributes.summaryProcess: Steps to summarize raw journal content.
attributes.recommendationLogic: Logic for generating recommended updates to the model based on journal entries.
attributes.approvalProcess: User approval workflow for incorporating journal content into the model.
